This protocol is used for eDNA metabarcoding of the 18S SSU rRNA Gene (Balzano et al 2015) using Pair-End Illumina MiSeq Sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":64}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f504u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"508bb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76upb","text":"Method description and rationale
Assuming extracted DNA as starting material, this protocol includes the following steps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9sjti","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2invh","text":"First PCR: Triplicate locus-specific amplification of the 320 bp ling "Leray fragment" of the COI gene.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ba35","text":"First PCR product purification (using magnetic beads)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4da0h","text":"Second PCR: Sample indexing using Nextera V2 indexing primers","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r8ev","text":"Second PCR product purification (using magnetic beads)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mmp2","text":"Quantification and Pooling","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dn74p","text":"Quality control","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6uk6v","text":"Pair End Sequencing on Illumina MiSeq V3 2*300 bp","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqa4u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gphj","text":"Due to the risk of cross contamination, it is pivotal to separate work with amplified PCR products from pre-PCR steps. We preform pre-PCR steps (including DNA extractions) in separate clean rooms on surfaces steralized with hydrogen peroxide (PreEmpt) and UV.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dn951","text":"
Spatial coverage and environment(s) of relevance
As part of the Hakai Institute Ocean Observing Program, biomolecular samples have been collected weekly, from 0 to near bottom (260 m), to genetically characterize plankton communities in the Northern Salish Sea since 2015, developing a climatology from which we can begin uncover the physical, chemical and biological drivers of community and functional change in the dynamic coastal waters of coastal British Columbia. This protocol is developed to give a species-level resolution of marine eukaryotes.

Personnel Required

Identify hazards associated with the procedure and specify protective equipment and safety training required to safely execute the procedure!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":2,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":2,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2un9","text":"
Training requirements

Time needed to execute the procedure
